intro: Leandra catharinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian orchid, is a species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), and it produces showy, white or pale yellow blooms. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
